TopicTitle: Why dev blog are not updated?

Articles.Content:
The last entries are from 2013?

I eagerly wait for new update:D

For now i not playing i wait for 0.24 when it release i put all games aside and play ksp all day long:-)

So much so I waited for the holidays to be able to take a break from university
I assume you're looking in the wrong place, since the devs do regularly post about the progress on the game.
The devs no longer use the dev blog system; they now use the article system.
I'm not sure what blog you mean. This is the official blog-thing: http://kerbaldevteam.tumblr.com/, but all the stuff is also posted here in the forum as "Daily Kerbal".

The devs no longer use the dev blog system; they now use the article system.

So they should delete blog
Maybe it would help if you linked to the blog you are talking about
I remember Ted saying something about writing his devblog a few weeks ago... Did he forget?
If I recall correctly HarvesteR wrote most of what Ted wanted to write in his Update Update back then
It seems like the devs had all switched to using the article system anyways, though.

Aye; I believe that is at least in part because the articles have a proper comment system, whereas blogs have a bit more of a mock up. As well as that, anyone can write a blog, so the devs' own blogs would get lost amongst the rest.

Thus, they use articles almost all of the time. Their old blog articles remain there for any who are curious to look at them, I guess.
